intro: Lepidagathis cuneiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed thornapple, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and southern Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring lance-shaped leaves and thorned stems. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its fruit is a capsule containing numerous small, hard seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Lepidagathis cuneiformis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
